entries.meaning: (animation) An action of tweening (inserting frames for continuity); a sequence of frames generated by tweening.
examples: Because the results of a shape tween can be unpredictable, you can set shape hints to let Flash know how to proceed with the tween.

verbs.description: tween (third-person singular simple present tweens, present participle tweening, simple past and past participle tweened)

entries.meaning: (cinematography) To generate intermediate frames in an animated sequence so as to give the appearance of smooth movement.
examples: Simple motion tweening moves your objects in a straight line from here to there. […] You can also combine frame-by-frame animation with tweened animation.

description: Blend of teen +‎ between in the sense of "between childhood and adolescence"

adjectives.description: tween (comparative more tween, superlative most tween)

entries.meaning: Of or having to do with tweenagers.
A child, especially a girl, in the age range between middle childhood and adolescence, normally between eight and thirteen years of age.
examples: When Play Along — the holder of the Care Bears master toy license — placed Care Bears plushes in Spencer Gifts last year, tweens and teenage girls bought the toys.

entries.meaning: (rare) a number or age in the twenties (plural only), or a person of that age
examples: At that time Frodo was still in his tweens, as the hobbits called the irresponsible twenties between childhood and coming of age at thirty-three.
